summary: Radix Bupleuri (Chai Hu in Chinese) is believed to be one of the most important herbal medicines in china. it has been widely used in traditional Chinese medicine (TCM) for its effects of relieving exterior syndrome, clearing heat, regulating the liver-qi, and lifting yang-qi. many valuable and important activities of Radix Bupleuri have been discovered. they include anti-inflammatory (Xie et al. 2012), antitumor (Liu & Li 2014), antidepressant (Jin et al. 2013), antiviral (Chiang et al. 2013a), hepatoprotection (Wang et al. 2013a), immunoregulation (Ying et al. 2014), and neuromodulation activities. saikosaponins are oleanane type triterpenoid saponins. they are divided into seven types according to different aglycones.
